definition: to get panicky/to lose one's head/(coll.) (after 得) unbearably/terribly

sentences.english: Will also descend the tunnel sees, always listen to than other people panic nervous Zhang Dao the way say well.
sentences.chinese: 也会下隧道去看，总比别人慌慌张张道听途说的好。

sentences.english: You may run out of your house and forget to lock the door once in a while.
sentences.chinese: 隔三岔五就会慌慌张张地从家里跑出去忘记锁门吧？

sentences.english: She went helter-skelter down the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 她慌慌张张地走下楼梯。

sentences.english: Panic's whiskers brush against her cheek.
sentences.chinese: 他的胡子慌慌张张地在她脸上扫过。

sentences.english: There is no need to rush into a relationship or be in a panic to find a life partner.
sentences.chinese: 无需匆匆地确定关系，活慌慌张张滴找个伴侣。

sentences.english: There are still one and a half hours to go , we needn’t be insuch a hurry .
sentences.chinese: 还有一个半小时，我们无需如此慌慌张张。

sentences.english: Scrambling around at the last minute to figure out what you are teaching brings on a bundle of stress.
sentences.chinese: 到最后一分钟才慌慌张张地准备会给你带来很多压力。

sentences.english: He skyrocketed into the room and knock down a chair.
sentences.chinese: 他慌慌张张冲进了屋，撞翻了一把椅子。

sentences.english: He messed up and dropped the ball.

definition: rolling and crawling/trying frantically to escape (idiom)
